channel.title: Guess?
channel.description:
Guess Jagex's first runescape server specs.... Im curious what you guys come up with + come up with some sort of reasoning to your guess.
and if you could estimate how many rsc server players there are (that are still around) that would be great to.

item.title: Guess?

item.description:

bamboozola:

hope jagex closes all rsc servers somehow someway.

item.title: Guess?
item.dc:creator: @poj poj
item.description:
@poj wrote:

hmm i have server parts dating back then,
il guess a dual cpu mobo with 2X xeon 1.8ghz or 3.0ghz single core cpu’s and about 4 - 16gb’s of ram and about 5 40 - 50 gb ide hdd’s 7200 rpm running in raid and a 10,100,1000 mbit oh and deffinetly a ati rage integrated all in a 1u forum factor in a rack probably like 6, on a 20u rack with 2 switches and a buisness connection from the uk to the rest of the world… and one of the servers run apache rest run the server its self… most likely on windows 2000 server or a type of linux posibly NT. server or somthing like that even. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Guess?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

Our main database server has twice as much memory (it now has 2gig)

2002

The San Francisco servers have now been upgraded to work through a faster network switch. The upshot of all this is that there is now three times as much bandwidth, and players should experience less lag to these servers.

June 1 2004 (this might be rs2)
The huge number of files the server is sending to everyone combined is slowing it down a bit, but once everyone has them things should return to normal.
I’ve just temporarily slowed down the rate at which the server sends the maps and music which should reduce the in-game lag a bit, but it will probably still be about 24 hours before things calm down to normal levels. After which point I’ll speed the download rate up again.

Read full topic

item.title: Guess?
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:5, topic:349727”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=446101.msg3274228#msg3274228 date=1279428878]

Are we just throwing numbers around to have fun or do you actually know the real answers?

Nobody will know the real numbers except for the ex staff if we could contact them…
other then that we guess. What was a top of the line pc around the year 2000-2001 + networking
[/quote]
the PC i said, is around that era[/quote]

know a top of the line internet service provider in the UK?
So guessing they had a single core they built the server for there type of processor (from what im thinking).

Just getting a feel for what they had + how far there development was compared to ours.

Read full topic
